He is confused and distorted. It is not the police who should talk to him, but a psychologist at this point to get the truth out. He is talking out of confusion with no sense of time, place of the events after the stabbing. He knows he did a grave mistake and at 17 getting confused for this crime can be expected. I don't think he is lying deliberately. He needs to be made calm to put the shattered pieces of his mind together. Police cannot do this.
